name: Caesium hydride
desc: Caesium hydride (CsH) is a compound of caesium and hydrogen. It is an alkali metal hydride. It was the first substance to be created by light-induced particle formation in metal vapor, and showed promise in early studies of an ion propulsion system using caesium.
Appearance: White or colorless crystals or powder[1]
Other cations:
LiH, NaH, KH, RbH,
and all other hydrides
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
